<Commercial speech
1:
--------------------
Text: Commercial speech:  It is economic in nature and usually has the intent of convincing the audience to partake in a particular action, often purchasing a specific product.
Triplets:<commercial speech
2:
--------------------
Text: Commercial speech:  Generally, the United States Supreme Court defines commercial speech as speech that "proposes a commercial transaction."
Triplets:<Commercial speech
3:
--------------------
Text: Commercial speech:  The Court developed a three factor inquiry in determining whether speech is commercial in the 1983 case "Bolger v. Youngs Drug Products" namely, (1) is the material meant to be an advertisement, (2) does the material reference a particular product, and (3) is there is an economic motivation for disseminating the material?
Triplets:<Commercial speech
5:
--------------------
<Text: Commercial speech:  These factors have yet to be utilized in other Supreme Court cases dealing with commercial speech.>
Triplets:<Commercial speech
